article.Heading: Withdrawal limits to ease by Feb-end; 6.7% GDP growth seen: SBI
article.Summary: On the upcoming Budget, Arundhati Bhattacharya, chairman of SBI said that investment and consumption should get equal focus.
article.Body:
The curb on withdrawal of money from ATMs is likely to ease by February-end, said the State Bank of India Chairman Arundhati Bhattacharya.

The Demonetisation situation has eased considerably. Only rural areas are seeing shortage of cash due to small and limited ATMs. She added that currently 80-85 percent cash availability is there.

The main fear is that people could go back to using cash once the situation normalizes. Withdrawals have picked up in recent days, she said.

On the upcoming Budget, Bhattacharya said that investment and consumption should get equal focus.

The government can incentivise home loans and could provide some relief on direct taxes. While on the investment front, the government must look at what is holding up investments in the private sector.

SBI expects the economy to grow at around 6.7 percent in the current fiscal.

Watch video for more...
